channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Open Office Hours with Lally Dean Liad Wagman
item.description: Exploring opportunities, have an idea, or want to ask questions? Stop by Dean Wagman’s Open Office Hours on Tuesday, February 24 from 2:00–3:00 p.m. in the Pittsburgh Building, Room 3104. No appointment needed. Come with questions, ideas, or simply a desire to explore opportunities and get more involved.

item.title: Spring Break 2026 Hours – Residential and Retail Dining
item.description: Spring Break is almost here! Residential Dining Halls (BARH, Blitman, Commons, and Russell Sage) will be closed February 28th, 2026 - March 7th, 2026. Retail Hours can be found in the link above. Normal residential and retail dining hours of operations will resume on March 9th, 2026. Have a safe and relaxing Spring Break!

item.title: RPI at Work Hosts Graduate Certificate Review on March 10
item.description: Date: Tuesday, March 10, 2026 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join RPI at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., in a 30-minute information session highlighting the whole range of RPI’s online, project-based graduate certificate programs. These certificates are three courses in length, developing targeted ability groups, and can be completed in as little as seven months. Please complete the form below if you plan to attend.

item.title: Drop-In Tutoring
item.description: Did you know that the Student Success Center offers tutoring at three locations on campus this semester? The Success Center, ECAV, and our newest location Nason! Check out our Tutoring Schedule for more info: https://successcenter.rpi.edu/tutoring

item.title: Small Group Tutoring Options at the Success Center
item.description: Did you know that you can easily book online a small group tutoring session in many of RPI’s upper-level courses? Check out the fantastic small group tutoring sessions being offered at the Success Center!

item.title: Information Security - Vote on Top 3 AI Phish Coach Names:
item.description: Thank you everyone for sending proposed names for our new AI Phishing Coach! After team vote, we have narrowed our selection down to the top three choices: bAIt and tackle, Phishing Net, and PhishStick. Please click above link to vote for your favorite name! Voting will close on Monday, March 2nd.

item.title: EMPAC Tour (Registration required)
item.description: Saturday / February 28, 2026 at 11:00 am EMPAC building tours take visitors behind the scenes to experience the center’s infrastructure as few do. Each one is hosted by an EMPAC staff member with a different area of expertise—so whether you attend one or all this season, there’s always something new to learn and discover. Join us! item.title: Fidelity Confidential Consultation (In Person)
item.description: Date: Thursday, February 26, 2026 8:00 AM - 4:30 PM - Schedule a confidential consultation to help you become better informed and more confident about your workplace retirement savings plan benefits. To schedule an appointment, call 1-800-642-7131, Monday through Friday, 8:00 am to midnight, or online at https://nb.fidelity.com/public/nbpreloginnav/rpi/microsite/#/tem/meet-with-us

item.title: Faculty & Staff Appreciation Lunch - February 26, 2026
item.description:
Join us for a Faculty and Staff Appreciation Lunch on Thursday, February 26, 2026, at The Commons and Russell Sage Dining Halls! As a thank you for all that you do, we’re offering a delicious all you care to eat lunch at a special price of just $6.00 plus tax. We look forward to seeing you there!
